entry.title: Qualtrics survey responses to LMS
entry.content:
Use Case Overview:

I’m currently using a Qualtrics survey to capture attendance for a training session. The survey collects minimal information — specifically, the employee ID and the name of the training attended.

Objective:

I want to integrate the responses captured in Qualtrics (from the Data & Analysis tab) into SuccessFactors LMS. Specifically, I’m looking to understand:

  • Where in SuccessFactors LMS can these responses be mapped or stored?
  • Is there a recommended module or section within LMS where training attendance data from external sources like Qualtrics can be integrated?

entry.title: Where I get the Practice Questions of SAP C_BOCR_08 Prep?
Re: SAP BTP ABAP Environment – New software delivery option “Add-On Product”
entry.content:
In the table “Overview about the two delivery options for commercial partners” it mentions that “Product Offering in SAP Store is Mandatory”.

The pre-requisites for an SAP Partner to keep their PartnerEdge Build status is to have at least one solution listed on the SAP store, correct? This solution is called GTM-ready by SAP. When the solution is listed there, the partner has to comply with SAP’s revenue-sharing and related policies.

As a PartnerEdge Build partner, we already have a solution listed on the SAP Store. 

Question: If we create solutions in the future that are SAP BTP extensions (either ‘key-user extensibility’ or ‘developer extensibility’) is it mandatory to add those specific solutions to the SAP Store before selling them to a customer/partner? Or is it only mandatory to have at least 1 (any/other) solution on the store, like we already have?

entry.title: Reporting of GHG emissions - Receiving of actual emissions sent by your carrier
entry.content:
Transportation Management (TM) in SAP S/4HANA 2023 introduces enhanced capabilities for calculating, incorporating into planning, and visualizing the carbon footprint of transportation.

However, there is more to it. Sustainability as part of Transportation Management offers a comprehensive overview of these features. In the blog post titled "Maintain Carbon Emission on Vehicle Type" authored by my colleague Michael Haase, we detail the necessary master data setup for accurate calculations.

Additionally, we provide the option to manually maintain received actual emission values for your Transportation Orders, as provided by the carrier. What has been lacking, until now, is the capability to automatically update these actual values using an API.

In this blog post, we aim to equip you with the tools necessary to achieve automated actual emission value updates on the header level, contributing to your sustainability journey.

KBA 3654588 outlines the step-by-step process for accomplishing this.

Following the approach detailed, an inbound message, sent externally—for instance, by the carrier—will include two new fields: one for the emission value and another for the unit of measure. 

                            
<TransportationEventNotificationMessage>
<MessageHeader>
</MessageHeader>
<TransportationEvent>
<ObjectReference>
<TransportationOrderID>61001369908</TransportationOrderID>
</ObjectReference>
<Event>
<EventTypeCode>REPORT_EMIVAL_DOC</EventTypeCode>
<EventReasonText>CO2 emission Updated.</EventReasonText>
<ExpectedDateTime>XXX</ExpectedDateTime>
<EstimatedDateTime/>
<ActualDateTime>XXX</ActualDateTime>
<n1:EmissionValue xmlns:n1="http://gtt.com/xi/TMS/EventNotif_In">1256</n1:EmissionValue>
<n1:EmissionValueUom xmlns:n1="http://gtt.com/xi/TMS/EventNotif_In">KG</n1:EmissionValueUom>
</Event>
</TransportationEvent>
</TransportationEventNotificationMessage>

Fig. 1 illustrates the enhanced payload.

This will update your Freight Order 61001369908 accordingly. Activating the views for carbon emissions in the Freight Order will display a window that shows the reported carbon emissions.

Fig. 2 illustrates the reported carbon emissions.

Navigating to the Execution Tab displays event information. Specifically, we are interested in the event that pertains to the reported emission values.

Fig. 3 illustrates the received event 'Report Emission Values for Documents' as part of your execution data.

 

That's it for now.

Stay tuned, there is even more to come.

entry.title: SAP MaxAttention IWS 'SAP Business Data Cloud: Advance into a bold new era of data and AI' (Oct 15)
entry.content:
Virtual

October 15, 2025

Agenda

We are pleased to invite you to the SAP MaxAttention Innovation Workshop focusing on ‘SAP Business Data Cloud: Advance into a bold new era of data and AI’ taking place virtually on October 15th, 2025. Please find the current agenda here.

In this workshop, you will explore how SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) is redefining enterprise data management and laying the foundation for AI innovation across the business landscape. Through keynote insights, customer roundtables, and expert-led sessions, attendees will explore the full potential of SAP BDC in transforming their data landscape.

  • Gain a clear understanding of how BDC provides a trusted, harmonized data foundation, empowering IT and business leaders to make more impactful, data-driven decisions
  • Learn how BDC connects and governs all enterprise data using business data fabric principles, enabling seamless integration, sharing, and modeling across systems
  • Discover how to transition from your current data landscape to BDC through guided strategies and hear from peers about their experiences with BDC's unified data capabilities, advanced analytics, seamless integration with platforms like SAP Databricks and AI-readiness

You will walk away with a clear understanding of how to transition to SAP Business Data Cloud, what technical and strategic value it brings, and how it can power a bold new era of data-driven innovation and AI-readiness. SAP MaxAttention will support you every step of the way from initial planning to full adoption helping to maximize the impact of their data platform modernization and AI strategy.

Our Workshops

These sessions and workshop series focus on a specific topic and the purpose is to enable our customers to understand the product portfolio and innovative technologies of SAP in order to drive adoption and consumption. As specifically now, it is more important than ever to help companies to be successful and to respond to changing markets by transforming into intelligent enterprises in the experience economy.

Important

Please note that the 'Attend' button which can be found within this blog post does not serve as a formal registration for the event.

To officially register, please reach out to me, paul.schropp@sap.com and I will ensure that your registration is properly processed.

We look forward to having you join us for our upcoming events and thank you for your understanding!

Your feedback

Feel free to share your feedback and thoughts in the comment section below.

entry.title: Re: How are markup, customs, and freight amounts—posted t...
entry.content:
The origin group is typically used to categorize costs for cost component splits or detailed analysis. But if the system is configured correctly, actual costing will still absorb the values from MIGO postings; even without origin group, because the material ledger captures all inventory-relevant postings.

So to answer your question, Yes, in SAP S/4HANA, markup, customs, and freight posted via purchase conditions at MIGO can be added to actual costing without using the origin group. The key is to ensure that the condition types are inventory-relevant, mapped to cost-relevant account keys, and that the material ledger is active. This setup allows the costs to be absorbed into the material’s actual cost during goods receipt

entry.title: Duplicated invoice posting issues for ERS job
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

We"ve met duplicated invoice posting issues for ERS job.

Background: When we create Purchase order, post goods issue, we use ERS function, schedule supplier invoice job, to create the invoice every day. Normally, once the invoice was posted for the goods receipt document, at the next day, it won"t create the invoice again.

Problem: We have purchase order 4500004906, the goods receipt document 500000263 was reversed by 500000264 on the same day before ERS job run.

When run ERS job, it created a supplier invoice job with amount 0.

The problem is that system created the supplier invoice with amount 0 every day for the same goods receipt document 500000263 and 500000264.

Questions:

Why system can create the supplier invoice many times for the same goods receipt document (with its reversal document)?

Why ERS job can create the supplier invoice job with amount 0? (When use APP "Create supplier invoice, it cannot post the invoice with amount 0).

Temporary solution:

There are many reversal GR documents like above example, we cancelled the job, and rescheduled it, changed the goods receipt posting date from Sep.12, then the problem is solved.

Questions: How can we avoid such duplicated posting issues in future?

Thank you.

Best Regards,

Grace

entry.title: Re: Code Vulnerability Analyzer Checks
entry.content:
Dear Martin,

All CVA checks are listed in SAP Note 1921820. You can identify new checks by the "Release" column.

Regarding SAP Note 3326886 – yes, you are right. It is not possible to provide complete protection using only static security scans; you also need other security measures. The situation is similar to AUTHORITY-CHECK: you may have correct AUTHORITY-CHECK statements in your code, but they will not help if users have inappropriate authorizations, e.g., SAP_ALL.

entry.title: Re: Bridging the gap with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Safekeeper
entry.content:
No. Safekeeper is only available as an upsell for RISE with SAP S/4HANA cloud, private edition / SAP Cloud ERP Private cloud services or RISE with SAP S/4HANA cloud, private edition, tailored option / SAP Cloud ERP Private, tailored option cloud services.

Safekeeper is not available for on-premise solutions.

On-premise customers that want to utilize Safekeeper need to move to RISE with SAP S/4HANA cloud, private edition / SAP Cloud ERP Private or RISE with SAP S/4HANA cloud, private edition, tailored option / SAP Cloud ERP Private, tailored option while their system is still in Mainstream or Extended Maintenance in order to then afterwards be in a position to benefit from Safekeeper.

As an example, a customer on SAP S/4HANA on-premise release 1709 would have to move to RISE before end of 2025 to then benefit from Safekeeper in the time frame Jan 1, 2026 to March 31, 2028.

entry.title: Re: Duplicated invoice posting issues for ERS job
entry.content:
I could see two reasons to your root cause of the issue for the system Creating Duplicate Invoices with Amount 0.

ERS jobs evaluate open GRs for invoicing. If a GR is reversed after posting but before ERS runs, the system still sees the original GR as eligible. The reversal document doesn’t always block the original GR from being picked up—especially if the reversal is on the same day and the ERS job doesn’t check reversal status properly.

When the ERS job picks up both the original GR and its reversal, the net quantity becomes zero. The system still tries to post an invoice, resulting in a zero-amount invoice. The “Create Supplier Invoice” app has stricter validation and blocks zero-amount invoices, but ERS jobs don’t always enforce that.

To fix this permanently, exclude the reversed GRs from ERS selection. This you can do with your ERS job variant or selection logic filters out reversed GRs, like movement type 102 or 122 should not be considered in your filter.

entry.title: Re: Set focus in MIRO transaction to field invoice receiv...
entry.content:
If you're using SAP S/4HANA with Fiori, consider switching to the “Create Supplier Invoice” Fiori app, which offers better control over field behavior and user experience.

If you're using SAP GUI for Windows, you can use SAP GUI scripting to automate cursor placement. You can trigger it via a desktop shortcut or automation tool. But please note, SAP GUI scripting must be enabled on both client and server side.

entry.title: Re: SAC date filter in story: how to get most current dat...
entry.content:
@Sascha_Wahl 

I do not think there is a standard straightforward solution for this. May be you can try a workaround. Create a table with very limited data which is most guaranteed to exist. Set the filter of this table to current year and months with booked behavior for date. You can read the date filter from this table using scripting which would return an array of months. Find the max of this values. mostly it would be the last value of the array. Now use this value to set the story filter.

Helpful API's

getdimensionfilter, setDimensionFilterWithHierarchy

https://help.sap.com/doc/1639cb9ccaa54b2592224df577abe822/release/en-US/index.html#FileDataSource

 

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: How to change company code currency from KHR to USD i...
entry.content:
Hello @Vanna_nh 

Changing the company code currency (10) is not possible in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, as previously mentioned by @puneetkalra.

Whenever you're working with tolerance limits, LVA thresholds, or similar settings, make sure to always use the company code's currency, which is KHR(in this case).

If policies need to be in USD, you can either convert them into KHR or re-provision the company code with USD as the currency type.

Below are some useful SAP documents for public use

  • Managing Currency Types-SAP Learning
  • Currencies-SAP Help
  • Maintain Exchange Rates-SAP Help

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: 🔵 Accelerate SAP CAP and Fiori Development with AI Tools
entry.content:
Vibe coding is a rapid, exploratory approach that enables developers to quickly experiment, prototype ideas, and iterate in real-time. While this approach encourages creativity and innovation, vibe coding alone often falls short in delivering sustainable, enterprise-grade applications. To bridge this gap, context engineering provides a disciplined framework- capturing domain insights, clarifying business objectives, and aligning technical solutions with measurable outcomes before writing code.
 
Learn how to channel these practices into enterprise-grade SAP development: you’ll see how AI tooling such as Cline can now scaffold Cloud Application Programming (CAP) services and Fiori UIs in minutes- while its new native SAP AI Core integration plugs straight into your organization's foundation-model deployments for secure, compliant generation.
 
Speaker
  • Palavalli Mahesh

entry.title: Issue with IF() syntax in SAC Grid Table formula
entry.content:
Hi ,

I'm trying to use an IF() statement in a Grid Table formula in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) to avoid division by zero when calculating variance. The platform accepts a simple formula like:

(F3 - E3) / E3

But when I try to use:

IF(E3 = 0, NULL, (F3 - E3) / E3)

I get a syntax error. I’ve tested other variations like:

  • IF(E3 <> 0, (F3 - E3) / E3, NULL)
  • IF(ISNULL(E3), NULL, (F3 - E3) / E3)

None of them work in the Grid Table context.

ps : I'm not using a calculated measure or story formula—this is directly in a Grid Table cell.

Is IF() not supported in Grid Table formulas?\ Where can I find official documentation listing supported functions in this context?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: Production order Item number of reservation RSPOS cha...
entry.content:
The IDoc (e.g., MBGMCR or MBCREATE) carries the original RSPOS from the reservation. This reflects the component item number as maintained in the production order via RESB.

During goods movement posting, SAP may renumber or reassign RSPOS in the material document due to:

  • Partial goods issues
  • Multiple components with same material
  • Backflush logic
  • Batch splits or serial number handling

The system sometimes reuses or reassigns item numbers to optimize document structure, especially if multiple movements are merged.


Check the following

  • Go to RESB Table and confirm the original reservation item number for the component.
  • Go to MKPF/MSEG and check how the item is posted in the material document.
  • Go to CO03 and see if multiple components share the same material or have batch splits.
  • Some movement types like 261 may trigger internal renumbering.

entry.title: Devtoberfest 2025 - Integration track sessions
entry.content:
We are days away from the first session of this year's Devtoberfest, our annual virtual celebration dedicated to the SAP developer community. Like previous years, there is a lot going on in the integration space, and as part of Devtoberfest 2025 we will have sessions covering the following topics: Architecture, AI, Event-driven Architectures, Tools for integration developers, open source and more.

As you might be aware, every track is assigned a unique day across the four weeks that Devtoberfest takes place and Wednesdays will be all about integration.

Devtoberfest 2025 sessions

You can find all the different tracks/sessions that are part of Devtoberfest here. You can filter all events by selecting the topic (label) you are interested in, e.g. integration 😉.

Let me quickly share all the sessions that we will have as part of the integration track:

1st of October:

  • 09:30 - 🔴Pipeline for Cloud Integration
  • 11:00 - 🔴 Clean Core, Event-Driven: Unlocking SAP Value with Advanced Event Mesh
  • 13:00 - 🔴 SAP Architecture Center: A GitHub-based Approach for Architectural Collaboration around Solution Diagrams
  • 15:00 - 🔴 IT System Landscape Transparency with Open Resource Discovery (ORD)

8th of October:

  • 09:30 - 🔴 Warp-Speed for Event Creation: Overview on the new Event Add-on for ERP
  • 11:00 - 🔴 Hands-on session: practical demonstration of the Event Add-on for ERP
  • 13:30 - 🔴 Enterprise in Motion: Event-Driven Architecture Use Cases for Innovation and Agility
  • 17:00 - 🔴 Unleash Next-Generation Hybrid Integration with Edge Integration Cell

15th of October:

  • 09:30 - 🔴 Using Intermediate Message Events and Success Factors Events in SAP Build Process Automation
  • 11:00 - 🔴 Seamless side-by-side extensibility with SAP Build and SAP Cloud Application Event Hub
  • 13:30 - 🔴 SAP Cloud ALM - Integration & Exception Monitoring in Context for SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration)
  • 15:00 - 🔴 Partner Directory Accelerator Tool for Pipeline Concept - an SAP open-source project

22th of October:

  • 09:30 - 🔴 AI for Integration Excellence: Modernize, Optimize, Thrive
  • 13:30 - 🔴 A(P)I: Unified connectivity for AI applications using MCP

Note: If you click on any of the times of the sessions above, you will download the calendar invite for the session.

So go ahead and RSVP to the different sessions you are interested in. Also, make sure to download the calendar invites so that you don't miss the session and you can get a chance to ask the speaker any questions that you might have about the topic.

Happy learning this Devtoberfest 2025!

entry.title: Re: Role Collection Assignment in Build Work Zone, Standard Edition
entry.content:
Hello Rohit, 

You have 3 options for user creation.

1. Manually. if you go this route you could use APIs to create some program/ UI to create/ update/ delete users at Mass.

2. Not using IAS - If your sub account is connected to azure AD, then you could use the option "Create Shadow Users on User Logon" in your trust configuration in the sub account. When users login, their ID will be automatically created in BTP.

3. Using IAS - If your sub account is connected to IAS, then you could use the option "Create Shadow Users on User Logon" in your trust configuration in the sub account. When users login, their ID will be automatically created in BTP. However you will also need to schedule a job in IPS to sync users from your backend system (SuccessFactors for example) to IAS. This is the recommended approach as all SAP products are going through IAS.

Julius

entry.title: Re: Crystal Reports RAS VerifyDatabase can't find an unkn...
entry.content:
I don't have access either, something in the browser is not showing all of the info. I don't know why, try a different browser... some times it show the info and sometimes not... I found that using Ms Edge shows the info...

Resolution

  • Crystal Reports for Visual Studio 2010 installs a database logging file called crlogger.dll and is located in:
  • 32 bit Operating Systems only ( OS )
    • C:\Program Files (x86)\SAP BusinessObjects\Crystal Reports for .NET Framework 4.0\Common\SAP BusinessObjects Enterprise XI 4.0\win32_x86
  • 64 bit Operating Systems ( OS )
    • C:\Program Files (x86)\SAP BusinessObjects\Crystal Reports for .NET Framework 4.0\Common\SAP BusinessObjects Enterprise XI 4.0\win64_x86
    • C:\Program Files (x86)\SAP BusinessObjects\Crystal Reports for .NET Framework 4.0\Common\SAP BusinessObjects Enterprise XI 4.0\win32_x64
  • To enable database logging add the following to your local System Environment Variables:
    • LOGGING_DIR = c:\logging
    • LOGGING_ENABLED_ASSERT = 1
    • LOGGING_ENABLED_RUNTIME = 30
  • To disable logging simply rename crlogger.dll to crlogger.org in both x86 and x64 locations. Or remove the environment variables.

This link has the info to enable tracing:

https://remiware.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/38544626572563-How-To-Enabled-Crystal-Reports-Connection-Tracing-and-Logs

I understand your question but as I said, the SDK assumes the report is 100% so calling Verify doesn't work the same as in CR Designer, CRD has a lot built in macro's that does things the SDK doesn't and can't do.

What you need to do is debug the error in CRD to figure out what the actual cause is, it could be DB linking, Database info doesn't match with the connection info as compared to what is saved in the RPT file etc.

Without knowing the actual cause I can't suggest anything.

Note also the SDK can't do field mapping, if that is the cause, you'll see a field mapping UI in CRD, there is no equivalent API in SDK.

I can't send you my main test app, it has a lot of internal notes and other things I can't make public. I did give it to Dan in Support, my old sort of manager, but I don't know if he made it public either.

So you need to figure what the cause is in CRD then possibly I can suggest some new routines to add to you upgrade tool...

entry.title: Re: Cash-Flow Report with Document Types
entry.content:
With the Group Reporting Preparation Ledger (GRPL) concept you can extend the GR data model to include custom fields like BLART. This involves:

  • creating a custom field in ACDOCU like ZBLART
  • populating it via data enrichment logic during GRPL transformation
  • using it in SAC reporting or custom rule logic

This is the most scalable and future-proof approach

entry.title: Re: Request to Merge Two Plants into One ERP Warehouse in...
entry.content:
We describe the different options in our 

Warehouse Inbound Processing (3BR)

Solution Process

<https://pr.alm.me.sap.com/launchpad?sap-support-headless=true&sap-ui-language=en&sap-ui-theme=sap_horizon#processnavigator-display&/SolS/EARL_SolS-013/2508/SolP/3BR/?region=DE>

Chapter

Set Up Organizational Structure

or in our

Warehouse Management Setup Guide.docx (Public)

<https://pr.alm.me.sap.com/launchpad?sap-support-headless=true&sap-ui-language=en&sap-ui-theme=sap_horizon#roadmap-display&/group/658F507A-D6F5-4B78-9EE1-0300C5F1E40F/phaseaccelerator/82b2db84548d41209cda972f0fac428b:FA163ED752201EDABFE83D133CFCFD51>

Here’s the simple view of your SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Warehouse Management options. First, a quick glossary:

- Plant = the legal/organizational site (who owns the stock)

- Storage location = an inventory bucket inside a plant

- EWM warehouse = the physical warehouse run by Warehouse Management

 

Option 1: One plant, one warehouse (can have several storage locations)

- Setup: Plant 1010 has storage locations (e.g., Z05W, Z15W). Both are managed by the same EWM warehouse.

- When to use: You have one physical building serving one plant. You just separate stock logically (e.g., raw materials vs. finished goods).

 

Option 2: Several plants share the same physical warehouse

- Setup: Plant 1010 and Plant 2010 each have a storage location (Z05W, Z15W), but both point to the same EWM warehouse.

- When to use: One building is used by multiple plants/legal inventories, but operations are shared (same workers, equipment, layout).

 

Option 3: One plant uses several different warehouses

- Setup: Plant 1010 has two storage locations (Z05W, Z15W), each linked to its own EWM warehouse (two separate buildings/areas).

- When to use: You run multiple distinct warehouses for the same plant (e.g., a main DC and a spare-parts warehouse).

 

How to choose quickly

- One physical building?

  - Stock for one plant → Option 1

  - Stock for multiple plants → Option 2

- More than one physical building for the same plant → Option 3

 

Rules to remember

- A storage location belongs to one plant only.

- A storage location can be managed by only one EWM warehouse.

- One EWM warehouse can manage multiple storage locations (even from multiple plants).

 

Structural Changes

SAP Central Business Configuration (CBC) provides a dedicated management tool for your organization's structural alignment. The organizational structure management functionality is designed to streamline and enhance your company's configuration.

Set Up Organizational Structure App

This application facilitates the modeling of your organizational structure using predefined organizational units. It ensures that you can accurately reflect your company’s hierarchy and relationships.

Note

- To add or edit organizational units and relationships, utilize the "Edit" functionality provided within the app.

- Deleting confirmed organizational units is not permitted to ensure the integrity and traceability of your organizational structure.

You can not modify the confirmed mappings within the CBC system.

entry.title: Difference in Depreciation Parameters Between Local and Group Ledger (Fixed Assets)
entry.content:
Hello SAP community,

I'd like to share a situation I encountered and get some insights from fellow practitioners.

I had one FA creation request and processed as per the template. However, Now it came to the notice that the parameters for Local GAAP and Group GAAP ledgers are different. For other assets created, the settings plus parameters are the same but for this created assets useful life section differs, In Local GAAP it is 003 whereas in Group GAAP it is 005. Which means, it could be a manual error while creating Final Asset.

Has anyone else faced the similar issue? What can be done to correct the parameters here?

Thank you in advance for the valuable inputs!

Mohammad

entry.title: Re: A better way to create the Root-Child-Grandchild hierachy in RAP
entry.content:
Hi there @junwu!

The advantage is how the database tables are built.

If this worked, we would need to store the reference to the parent only in the child, therefore saving space on Grandchild and Great Grandchild.

Now imagine the root has 3 primary keys:

  • If one wants to get the key directly from db, in the Grandchild and Great Grandchild table he will have to store the 3 keys to the root, which are 3 columns extra.

  • If one goes through the join, the 3 extra columns are avoided, saving space.

And @junwu, I have a lot of respect for you. Whenever I have a question I cannot solve, I go to SAP Community and see you have an answer. However I have to disagree when you say that it makes no sense to go through the join.

Let's say there is a root A1. This root has one child B1, and this child has one grandchild C1. Now for whatever reason, the child B1 must change the parent to A2.

By going through the join, we don't have to manually change the root of C1. The root is automatically read through the join to B1.

This doesn't just make sense, it even is another advantage to using this method.
